contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | image = Red Spurfowl.JPG | image_caption = [[Red Spurfowl]] | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Aves]] | ordo = [[Galliformes]] | familia = [[Phasianidae]] | subfamilia = [[Perdicinae]] | genus = '''''Galloperdix''''' | genus_authority = [[Edward Blyth|Blyth]], 1845 | subdivision_ranks = Species | subdivision = * [[Red Spurfowl]],<br> ''Galloperdix spadicea'' * [[Painted Spurfowl]],<br> ''Galloperdix lunulata'' * [[Sri Lanka Spurfowl]],<br> ''Galloperdix bicalcarata'' }} '''''Galloperdix''''' are three [[species]] of [[Aves|birds]] in the pheasant family, [[Phasianidae]]. These [[Terrestrial animal|terrestrial]] birds are restricted to the [[Indian Subcontinent]], with the [[Red Spurfowl]] and [[Painted Spurfowl]] in forest and scrub in [[India]], and the [[Sri Lanka Spurfowl]] in forests of [[Sri Lanka]]. They share the common name "spurfowl" with the African members of the genus ''[[Pternistis]]''.<ref name=IOC>Gill, F, & Donsker, D. eds. (2010). ''[http://www.worldbirdnames.org/ IOC World Bird Names].'' Version 2.7. Accessed 15 January 2011.</ref> == References == {{Reflist}} [[Category:Spurfowls|*]] {{Galliformes-stub}}
